title: I spent $60 for 16 all organic meals
body:
Literally the same price for non organic foods at shaws/stop and shop when they don't discount everything. That's 8 days of food for me, thank you Whole Foods. 

Eating healthy and organic isn't as expensive as people make it out to be, maybe it was because it was just a bunch of veggies and meat and not premade food and I cook my meals instead.

In other words, $3.75 a meal for healthy wholesome goodness that is cheaper than fast food.

Edit: It's at least cheaper in my area, I live in a different economy than some of you because of MA inflation, I cook my own food, and I am talking about eating healthy food at reasonable prices.
